content.body: Does anyone still have a particular fondness for pairs? I'm pretty close to writing the relevant PRs to turn them into tuples. It doesn't seem like it would be all that much work.

annevk: how strongly do you prefer "site[0]" to "site's host" in https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/7251/files ? I find the latter a decent bit more readable, and I think it's pretty clear those are the components of a host-and-port...
content.formatted_body: annevk: how strongly do you prefer "site[0]" to "site's host" in https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/7251/files ? I find the latter a decent bit more readable, and I think it's pretty clear those are the components of a host-and-port...

content.body: Domenic: it's kind of an implicit tuple at the moment where we don't have defined names
content.formatted_body: Domenic: it's kind of an implicit tuple at the moment where we don't have defined names

content.body: Domenic: if we had defined names it would work, but if we don't I think this is better
content.formatted_body: Domenic: if we had defined names it would work, but if we don't I think this is better

content.body: (I think implicit tuples are fine, as you don't always want to define all the names and things are mostly clear from the name of the tuple itself.)
Alright, I guess I'll merge as-is. Feels like a bit of a shame though.
